quest.name: To Catch a Poacher
journal: Guildmaster Luciane wants you to go to Buscarron's Druthers.
The Archers' Guild has received a petition from a man named Buscarron, who runs a tavern in the South Shroud. Take yourself to Buscarron's Druthers and speak with the proprietor.
Buscarron asks you to investigate a gang of poachers who he believes are led by the infamous Pawah Mujuuk. Search the forest for any clues to their whereabouts.
You discover several suspicious objects in the forest northwest of Buscarron's Druthers. Return to the tavern and share your findings with Leih and Silvairre.

Silvairre suspects that the bottles were taken from Buscarron's famous cache of home-brewed mead, thought lost in the fall of his former guard post. Investigate Buscarron's Scar for signs of recent activity.

At Buscarron's Scar, you are ambushed by Pawah Mujuuk and her gang of poachers. A skirmish ensues, during which you successfully repel the enemy. Bear word of this to Buscarron, who awaits you back at the Druthers.

Clearly nettled by the thought of the poachers helping themselves to his prized mead, Buscarron takes great pleasure in the tale of their comeuppance. With the situation under control, you can now return to the Archers' Guild and report all that transpired to Luciane.

At the Archers' Guild, Luciane praises you for your outstanding service at Buscarron's Scar. She then thanks you for helping Leih and Silvairre to cooperate, and bids you continue working for the benefit of the guild. Your efforts thus validated, you resume your training with heretofore unseen fervor.

※The next archer quest will be available from Luciane upon reaching level 25.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: You come at a good time, Forename. I have a task for you.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: A petition has arrived from the proprietor of Buscarron's Druthers, out in the South Shroud.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: The petitioner, Buscarron himself, has requested our assistance in dealing with a gang of poachers. I would have the three of you meet with him and investigate his claims.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: The three of us? You mean, Forename, myself, and...?

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: It would be better if I went alone, Luciane. The Miqo'te and...the other one will only encumber me.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: No, Silvairre, you will go as three. Also, it is past time you recognized Forename as a fellow archer.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: I will not. I have held my tongue on the matter of herhis continued presence here, but I will bend no further.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Who in the seven hells do you think you are─Bowlord Lewin!? In case you've forgotten, you aren't even a Quiverman anymore!

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: That may be, but I have shed blood defending our borders─unlike you, savage.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: "Savage“!? You know nothing about me, you bigoted son of a─

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: Enough!

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: But one more word and you shall have cause to regret your petulance. The three of you will go to Buscarron's Druthers in the South Shroud. Now, out of my sight!

dialogue.name: BUSCARRON
dialogue.text: Ah, you lot must be from the Archers' Guild. Welcome, friends.

dialogue.name: BUSCARRON
dialogue.text: Now, as your guildmaster will have said, I put in a request for some keen-eyed archers to help me track down a gang of poachers that've been plaguing these parts.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: If I may─it is not uncommon to find poachers in this region. While regrettable, neither the Gods' Quiver nor the Wood Wailers deem them worthy of attention. Why, then, did you imagine them worthy of ours?

dialogue.name: BUSCARRON
dialogue.text: 'Cause these ain't no common poachers. They're Pawah Mujuuk's gang.

dialogue.name: BUSCARRON
dialogue.text: They say she and hers are always moving, staying one step ahead. But I reckon she's hiding out here somewhere.

dialogue.name: BUSCARRON
dialogue.text: Thing is, I can't just send my people out searching. I made a pact with the Redbelly bandits, see─we stay out of their territory, and they don't make no trouble at the Druthers.

dialogue.name: BUSCARRON
dialogue.text: That being so, if I summoned the massed ranks of the Wailers and the Quivermen, all seven hells would swiftly break loose...assuming they thought the matter worthy of their attention, of course. Needless to say, that's not an option. As luck would have it, though, I've got three keen-eyed archers to take care of things instead─and all without raising no alarms.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: ...We understand. You may leave the matter to us.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Leih, Forename─split up and scour the area for any sign of the poachers.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Should you discover anything, return here and wait. We will reconvene to compare our findings ere long. Go.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: An iron leg trap and a poacher's arrow... These are both evidence of illegal activity, but nothing that will help us find Pawah.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: And these mead bottles are but old refuse, from before the Druthers was even built. They have no connection to the gang.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: ...What do you know of this Pawah woman, Silvairre?

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: I know that she is the most infamous poacher ever to walk the Twelveswood.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: A born leader, deadly with the bow, she formed her own gang of Miqo'te hunters.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: She was apprehended once, and would have been brought to justice...had she not tricked a foolish young sentry into releasing her, before vanishing without a trace.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: ...Is that so?

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: In any case, we've scoured the area and found nothing. How do we know that this Pawah was ever even here?

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: I say we inform the Gods' Quiver and the Wood Wailers, taking care not to implicate Buscarron, and leave the rest to them. This doesn't concern the Archers' Guild.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: It concerns Gridania, Leih! Pawah Mujuuk is a savage and utterly amoral poacher whose actions, however indirectly, threaten the city's well-being.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: But what would a vagrant like you know of duty to one's homeland? No more than shehe, I suspect.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: How dare you! And you, Forename─say something!

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Now is not the time for this!

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: You see? Even shehe knows it to be true. HerHis silence speaks volumes.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Damn it, Forename─say something!

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Hmph. Very well. We will return to the matter at hand. Mayhap we should take a second look at the clues we have gathered.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Look all you want. Though the trap and the arrow we found suggest poaching, there is nothing remotely unusual about them.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: What do you think we should examine, Forename?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you examine?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: The poacher's arrow.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: The iron leg trap.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: The empty mead bottles.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: We know that this is a poacher's arrow. Beyond that, it tells us nothing.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: This trap is a common tool used for hunting beasts.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Such devices do not distinguish between friend and foe, and have been the cause of much tragedy for both man and chocobo. Gridanian hunters would never stoop so low.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Poachers, meanwhile, are wont to litter the forest floor with these accursed things. That said, I see nothing here that will lead us to Pawah.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Why are you still carrying that rubbish? I told you, those bottles predate the Druthers. They have no connection with this matter.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: ...But if these bottles are so old, why do they retain the scent of mead? They must surely have been opened recently.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Wait. Before the Calamity, Buscarron once served as a sentry. Yet even then, he sometimes spoke of owning his own tavern...and it was an open secret that he was brewing his own private stock. If some survived...

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Of course! Buscarron's Scar─his old lookout post!

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: It may not be Pawah Mujuuk, but we must investigate at once!

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Any signs?

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Look─the ground is covered in Miqo'te footprints.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: These tracks are fresh─very fresh. I'll wager the bandits were alerted to our coming and fled...else they're hiding near─

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Take cover!

dialogue.name: PAWAHMUJUUK
dialogue.text: ...Eh? An' there I was thinkin' we'd caught usselves some o' them meddlin' bloody masqueraders...

dialogue.name: PAWAHMUJUUK
dialogue.text: Not that I'm complainin'─hidin' yer face's downright bloody rude when ye ain't been introduced.

dialogue.name: PAWAHMUJUUK
dialogue.text: Speakin' of ill manners, don't ye know it ain't decent to barge yer way into a lady's bedchamber without knockin'!?

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: ...You would lecture us on manners? Truly, I have heard it all.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: They have us outnumbered. We had best split up.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: The leader's mine! I'll try to isolate her from her litter!

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Silvairre, Forename─the rest I leave to you two.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: As you will.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Was that the last of them?

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Have you seen Aliapoh?

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: With me, Forename.

dialogue.name: PAWAHMUJUUK
dialogue.text: Tsk-tsk. That was a piss-poor showin', sister.

dialogue.name: PAWAHMUJUUK
dialogue.text: An' ye call yerself a Keeper? A hunter with no fangs ain't nothin' but prey.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: No!

dialogue.name: PAWAHMUJUUK
dialogue.text: Awww, bugger. Looks like playtime's over.

dialogue.name: PAWAHMUJUUK
dialogue.text: Be seein' ye, sister!

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: So it was Pawah Mujuuk after all. Buscarron must be informed.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Pawah Mujuuk... I...I was no match for her...

dialogue.name: BUSCARRON
dialogue.text: Seven hells! They were at my old post? And they drank my old mead!?

dialogue.name: BUSCARRON
dialogue.text: That stings most of all... Well, 'tis past time the proper authorities were informed. I'll send messengers to the Wood Wailers and Gods' Quiver.

dialogue.name: BUSCARRON
dialogue.text: The Redbelly bandits won't like it one bit, but I'll see they're told exactly who the military is after. I only hope it'll be enough...

dialogue.name: BUSCARRON
dialogue.text: 'Course, Pawah Mujuuk's no fool. Now she knows she's been spotted, she'll break camp and be long gone by the time the next bell sounds. And the trail won't stay fresh long, neither...

dialogue.name: BUSCARRON
dialogue.text: Anyway, you've done me a great kindness, friends. Tell Luciane I appreciate the help.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename. Silvairre tells me that you encountered Pawah Mujuuk.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: No Gridanian could fail to recognize that name, so oft has it been spoken, and with such bitterness.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: I fear we lack the strength to face her ourselves. This is a matter for the Gods' Quiver and Wood Wailers.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: That you confronted her and survived is a testament to your growing mastery of our art. Ah, and I was surprised to note that Leih and Silvairre were not at loggerheads upon their return. I presume we owe this unnatural state of affairs to your calming influence?

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: ...No? Modest to the last. Truly, your every deed bespeaks a clarity of vision far beyond your years.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: I implore you to share that perspective with your peers and help them to grow into better, wiser archers.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: As you go forth and temper your skills in battle, know that we always look forward to your return.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: You sense a hostile presence!

dialogue.name: INSTANCE
dialogue.text:
Duty calls. Do you wish to proceed with
“To Catch a Poacher”?

dialogue.name: INSTANCE
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: INSTANCE
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: UNNOWN
dialogue.text: For Pawah! Get the bastards!

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Focus on my target, Forename! We can take them down faster if we work together!

dialogue.name: UNNOWN
dialogue.text: Don't let them get away!

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: We cannot allow that conjurer to draw this out!

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Remember your techniques! Finish her quickly while she is weak!

dialogue.name: UNNOWN
dialogue.text: Bloody hells! Why won't you two die!?

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Stay on your toes, Forename! This lot is quicker than the rest!

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Watch their movements and dodge their attacks!

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Ugh... Hmph...
